paper_abstract: The mathematical approach proposed in this paper refers to the modelling of large systems of interacting entities whose microscopic state includes not only mechanical variables ( typically position and velocity), but also specific activities of the single entity. Their number is sufficiently large to describe the overall state of the system by a suitable probability distribution over the microscopic state. The first part of the paper is devoted to the derivation of mathematical structures which can be properly used to model a variety of models in different fields of applied sciences. Then, some research perspectives are focused on applications to biological systems. (C) 2007 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: From the mathematical kinetic theory of active particles to multiscale modelling of complex biological systems
